definition[0]: a position from which you can start to make progress and achieve your aims
example[0]: Extreme right-wing parties gained a foothold in the latest European elections.
definition[1]: a small hole or crack where you can safely put your foot when climbing a steep rock
definition[2]: part of a market that a company obtains, hoping to obtain more of the same market or part of another larger market that is related to it
example[1]: Several U.S. companies have teamed up with Mexican retailers to get a foothold in the huge Mexican market.
